thread.title: 'Gay KKK night out' - Newcastle leader Nick Forbes slams Labour Party member's 'offensive' tweet

author: Chris Knight
title: 'Gay KKK night out' - Newcastle leader Nick Forbes slams Labour Party member's 'offensive' tweet
text:
Newcastle City Council leader Nick Forbes and Labour Party member Lee Jasper Get daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Newcastle City Council leader Nick Forbes has slammed a Labour Party member for comparing LGBT councillors to the Ku Klux Klan.
Party member Lee Jasper made the "deeply offensive" comparison in a message posted on Twitter in response to a post shared by Labour's Local Government Association.
The association's account tweeted about a drop-in session for LGBT councillors, to which Mr Jasper replied: "Oh my days...Its like gay KKK night out." Lee Jasper at the Birmingham Race Summit held at the Rep Theatre, Birmingham.
Wednesday's post drew condemnation from dozens of Twitter users, including Councillor Forbes who attended the drop-in session.
Furious by the comparison, Coun Forbes posted: "I can’t believe a Labour Party member would say something so insensitive and insulting.
"Withdraw this tweet immediately. I am making a formal complaint to the Party about it." Read More Overstretched Newcastle council staff don't have time for Brexit 'navel-gazing', leader says
Mr Jasper - a press officer for Momentum Black Caucus and the former race and equalities adviser to Ken Livingston - has since deleted the controversial post.
Coun Forbes has now lodged a formal complaint about the incident with the Labour Party, and is hoping it will be treated with the "utmost seriousness". Leader of Newcastle City Council - Councillor Nick Forbes (Image: Newcastle Chronicle)
He said: “The tweet, making a comparison between LGBT councillors and the KKK, was deeply offensive and insulting.
"Such comments have no place in politics, and especially not in the Labour Party which has historically led the fight for LGBT rights.
"I have made a formal complaint to the Party about this tweet and I have had assurances from the General Secretary that this incident will be treated with the utmost seriousness.” Read More
A spokesperson for the Labour Party said “The Labour Party takes all complaints extremely seriously, which are investigated in line with our procedures."
Mr Jasper tweeted on Sunday claiming to have been suspended from the Labour Party.
He posted: "Been suspended again by @uklabour after right wing complaints that I’ve brought the party into disrepute as a result of my...wait for it...alleged anti Semitism, homophobia and anti black racism!
"All I need is Islamophobia and Disabilty complaints, and I’ll have the full set."
ChronicleLive has contacted Momentum Black Caucus and Mr Jasper for comment. Like us on Facebook
